Pledgie Donations

This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I am a proud member of RailsBridge, Helping new Rails developers get into our world and also contributed a few Patches to the Ruby on Rails core.

I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).

Bag O' Links - 17/11/2009 /
name age history
Bag O' Links - 17/11/2009 17/11/2009 Another post [Elad Meidar]
  • Accessing a nested association in Rails – This is actually an issue that is coming up way to often on #rubyonrails: how to access a nested association in rails with a simple accessor method.
  • Upload your Rails assets to S3 – A tutorial that shows a simple coupling between a capsitrano task and a rake task to manage uploads for S3.
  • Web application resource inspector – WARI scans your web application and examines dependencies between JavaScript functions, CSS styles, HTML tags and images. haven’t tried it yet but sounds neat.
  • Testing your site in english with cucumber – my favorite Cucumber slide.
  • Trying out Atlas280 – looks nice, but 20$ to test it?
  • Making a good API wrapper in Ruby – a few useful tips if you are planning on writing a Ruby wrapper.
  • jammit – an industrial strength asset packaging library for Rails
  • 11 Things to Consider Before Deploying Your Rails Application – good list of tips some of us tend to forget.
  • User roles in Rails applications – An authorization Rails plugin using a declarative DSL for specifying authorization rules in one place.
  • Super simple job queuing with AMQP – Minion makes processing jobs over AMQP simple and easy, looks like they are right.
  • Write website requirements without a product manager – some good reading if you are considering this kind of madness. :)
  • Cache-money trick – a quick tip to skip cachemoney when running on development environment.
  • Monitoring mySQL instances with munin – a quick tutorial.
  • Online desktops – a cool post with a brief overview of several online desktop services.
  • 10 common backup mistakes – keep away from those.
  • 10 things to know about Amazon RDS – i will be forced to try that soon.
  • CSS readability tips – making a happy stylesheet.
  • validates_uniqueness_of slowness – another addition to that troublesome validator.
  • autoload iptables on Ubuntu – u just needed that.
  • IntoVPS – VPS service provider, europe/USA options…worths checking out.
  • Console for Rack apps – use it to load application environment for Rails, Merb, Sinatra, Camping, Ramaze or your own framework provided there is config.ru file in app’s root directory.
  • midori – a lightweight javascript library – midori is an ultra-lightweight JavaScript framework that gets the job done without getting in your way.

Treasures

  • grit – Grit gives you object oriented read/write access to Git repositories via Ruby.
  • ShardTheLove – hardTheLove is a library we use in both Ruby frameworks for scaling our MySQL databases.
  • gmap-street-view – A Simple ruby gem for retrieving google street view.
  • Ruby IRC statistics generator – IRC logfile parser written in Ruby.
  • PostView – Postview is a simple blogware written in Ruby using the Sinatra DSL for render files written in Markdown.
  • dget – create local copies of Github wiki pages.
  • azbuka – CSS Typographical Base Rendering Library.
